column4: i am not being able to connect to a linksys router wireless connection
any help?
i cant connect to a linksys router, the model is wrt54g
everytime oi try to connect it says obtaining ID nad then it says it failed to obtain IP
to it matter of fact
but if i disconnect from wired and then try to login wireless
it says failed to obtain ip
how do you mean network layoutÂ¿?
there's a router connected to a cable connection which is wired to a windows computer
modem to router, router to windows pc and wireless for everyone
what kind of wifi card you have?
lspci in a terminal, if USB then lsusb
what do you get from the command "ifconfig"
you don't have wireless interface setup
you are using wicd - what does it show for the name of your wireless connection?
whats "cap"
you are too far ahead there - in wicd, you need to tell it what your  wireless interface is called - I use "wlan0"
this is configuring linux to use the wireless card
in WICD, you need to setup your wireless interface - tell it what you want to use - - I suggest using "wlan0" (thats a zero not an oh)
I don't have WICD installed right now.
WICD has a GUI
lets back up here - in a terminal type sudo iwlist scan and tell us what you see
sudo iwlist scan (without quotes)
again, no wifi interface is setup...
